comments: Also primes of form 5n+3.Union of A132233, A132235, {3}. - _Ray Chandler_, Apr 07 2009Primes p such that arithmetic mean of divisors of p^4 is an integer. There are 2 such sequences of primes, this one and A030430. - _Ctibor O. Zizka_, Oct 20 20095 is not quadratic residue of primes of this form. - _Vincenzo Librandi_, Jun 25 2014
links: Michael B. Porter, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..100000
A. Granville and G. Martin, Prime number races
mathematica: Select[Prime@Range[200], Mod[ #, 10] == 3 &] (* _Ray Chandler_, Nov 07 2006 *)Select[10 Range[0, 150] + 3, PrimeQ]  (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Apr 06 2011 *)
prog: (PARI) select(n->n%10==3, primes(500)) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Apr 29 2015
